game

Class Tetromino

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Tetromino

  • public class Tetromino
extends java.lang.Object
    A class managing the grid tiles configurations referred to as the tetrominos.
    Author:
    £ukasz Piekarski [wookashp98@gmail.com]

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Tile> blockConfigurationTile
      A list of Tile objects of corresponding tiles.
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> blockConfigurationX
      A list of x coordinates of corresponding tiles. 0 is the center with respect to which the tetromino can be rotated.
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> blockConfigurationY
      A list of y coordinates of corresponding tiles. 0 is the center with respect to which the tetromino can be rotated.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tetromino()
      Creates a new empty tetromino.
      Tetromino(int[] blockConfigurationX, int[] blockConfigurationY, Tile[] blockConfigurationTile)
      Creates a new tetromino from the given configuration.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTile(int x, int y, Tile t)
      Adds a new tile to the tetromino configuration with x and y coordinates.
      Tetromino copy()
      Creates a new tetromino object with the exact same field values.
      Tile getTile(int id)
      Gets the specific tile of the tetromino.
      int getTileX(int id)
      Gets the x coordinate of the specific tetromino tile.
      int getTileY(int id)
      Gets the y coordinate of the specific tetromino tile.
      Tetromino rotate(boolean counterclockwise)
      Creates a rotated version of the tetromino.

    • Field Detail

      • blockConfigurationX

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> blockConfigurationX
        A list of x coordinates of corresponding tiles. 0 is the center with respect to which the tetromino can be rotated.

      • blockConfigurationY

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> blockConfigurationY
        A list of y coordinates of corresponding tiles. 0 is the center with respect to which the tetromino can be rotated.

      • blockConfigurationTile

        private java.util.ArrayList<Tile> blockConfigurationTile
        A list of Tile objects of corresponding tiles.
        See Also:
        Tile

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tetromino

        public Tetromino(int[] blockConfigurationX,
                 int[] blockConfigurationY,
                 Tile[] blockConfigurationTile)
        Creates a new tetromino from the given configuration.
        Parameters:
        blockConfigurationX - A value for blockConfigurationX.
        blockConfigurationY - A value for blockConfigurationY.
        blockConfigurationTile - A value for blockConfigurationTile.

      • Tetromino

        public Tetromino()
        Creates a new empty tetromino.

    • Method Detail

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int id)
             throws UndefinedTileException
        Gets the specific tile of the tetromino.
        Parameters:
        id - Index of the tile to retrieve.
        Returns:
        A Tile object of the tetromino piece described at index id.
        Throws:
        UndefinedTileException - when there is no tile with index id.

      • getTileX

        public int getTileX(int id)
             throws UndefinedTileException
        Gets the x coordinate of the specific tetromino tile.
        Parameters:
        id - Index of the tile.
        Returns:
        Tile's x coordinate.
        Throws:
        UndefinedTileException - when there is no tile with index id.

      • getTileY

        public int getTileY(int id)
             throws UndefinedTileException
        Gets the y coordinate of the specific tetromino tile.
        Parameters:
        id - Index of the tile.
        Returns:
        Tile's y coordinate or 0 if tile with index id doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        UndefinedTileException - when there is no tile with index id.

      • addTile

        public void addTile(int x,
                    int y,
                    Tile t)
        Adds a new tile to the tetromino configuration with x and y coordinates. If there was any tile with such coordinates the new one overrides it.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate.
        y - The y coordinate.
        t - The tile object.

      • copy

        public Tetromino copy()
        Creates a new tetromino object with the exact same field values.
        Returns:
        A copy of the tetromino.

      • rotate

        public Tetromino rotate(boolean counterclockwise)
        Creates a rotated version of the tetromino.
        Parameters:
        counterclockwise - determines the rotation direction.
        Returns:
        Rotated version of the tetromino.
